subject: RE: [junit] JUnit with SAX Parser Error
msgSnippet: I ran into this when moving from JUnit 3.2 to 3.5. Specifying the -noloading parameter when running the Swing GUI fixed it. It has to do with the class loader.
messageBody:
I ran into this when moving from JUnit 3.2 to 3.5.

Specifying the -noloading parameter when running the Swing GUI fixed it. It
has to do with the class loader. I'm no expert so I can't explain it but
there are lots of other people in this group who can.

The only problem is that you have to restart the tests if you change
anything and want to rerun them. You can't just click the run button again
because the changed classes will not load. I consider this a small price to
pay for the ability to run the tests.
 
If you search the archive of this group, you'll find lots of explanations of why this happens. Look for -noloading.
 
Hope this helps,
Peter

Subject: [junit] JUnit with SAX Parser Error

When we try to apply JUnit to a test class which reads from an XML
document it appears that JUnit applies a custom class loader
(junit.runner.TestCaseClassLoader) which is then violated by the SAX
parser (a linkage error is thrown related to the JVM security). It
seems that the JUnit class loader is setting the security on the JVM
to be too restrictive. The full stack trace appears below.

This problem occurs with versions 3.6 and 3.7 of JUnit (with both the
Xerces and JAXP parsers). It does not occur with version 3.2 of JUnit
(we have not tried with any between 3.2 and 3.6).

Has anyone had a similar problem (or successfully used a JUnit 3.6 or
3.7 test class with a SAX parser)?

Can anyone suggest a workaround (prefereably not reverting to 3.2!).
We are quite new to JUnit and this is the first seemingly major
problem we have encountered.

Thanks,

Simon.
